channel.title: Mouse motion

item.title: Mouse motion
item.dc:creator: @m0u53m4t m0u53m4t
item.description:
@m0u53m4t wrote:

This is what they mean it should be like:
[scar]program motion;
{.include srl/srl.scar}
begin
setupSRL
ActivateClient
MMouse(500,500,6,6)
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

Oh, and before you use MMouse(), make sure you put SetupSRL; somewhere near the top of your main loop.

What do you mean?
Is this what you maen: {.include SRL/SRL.scar}

item.title: Mouse motion
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yer, And the reason why the window moves instantly in your script is because you have MoveMouse instead of MoveMouseSmooth when the script is holding the mouse button down

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse motion
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

MMouse(500, 500, 0, 0);

The last to numbers are the randomness allowed for x and y. If you put them at 0, 0 then it will end exactly on 500, 500.

Read full topic

Ah ok. Below your program motion; line, put {.include SRL/SRL.scar}

Then you can open up the manual and use the procedures and functions.

item.title: Mouse motion
item.dc:creator: @redragonje65 redragonje65
item.description:
@redragonje65 wrote:

Is there a function or a way to make the MoveMouseSmooth(x,y) function move slower? I’m trying to make a script that will move the scar window but it moves instantaneously. My script so far:

[scar]program motion;

procedure move1;
begin
movemousesmooth(251,15);
holdmouse(251,15,true);
movemouse(478,287);
releasemouse(478,287,true);
wait(1000);
end;

procedure moveback;
begin
movemousesmooth(478,287);
holdmouse(478,287,true);
movemouse(251,15);
releasemouse(251,15,true);
wait(1000);
end;

begin
move1;
moveback;
end.[/scar]

going to add constants and what nots.

Read full topic
